com.anthem.selenium.utils

Class DateTimeUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.anthem.selenium.utils.DateTimeUtils
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DateTimeConstants

    public class DateTimeUtils
extends Object
implements DateTimeConstants
    This class provides Utility methods of Date and Time functionalities.
    When using methods with customSeparator, make sure the separator is a valid for your Date or Time Formats.
    If the format requested is not valid, you will get java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Illegal pattern character...
    Author:
    shiva.katula

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface com.anthem.selenium.constants.DateTimeConstants

      • getIncrOrDecrDate

        public static Date getIncrOrDecrDate(int incrOrDecr,
                                     int typeOfIncrement)
        This method returns Date after Incrementing or Decrementing number of Days/Months/Years/Hours/Minutes/Seconds requested from Current Date.
        Parameters:
        incrOrDecr - Increment (+ve) or Decrement (-ve) number of Days/Months/Years/Hours/Minutes/Seconds
        typeOfIncrement - Increment (+ve) or Decrement (-ve) days/months/years
        Returns:
        Date Updated Date
        See Also:
        DateTimeConstants

      • getTimeStamp

        public static String getTimeStamp(String dateFormat,
                                  String timeFormat,
                                  String customSeparator)
        This method provides the Formatted Date and Time in requested Format separated with separator
        Parameters:
        dateFormat - Format of the date part to be returned
        timeFormat - Format of the time part to be returned
        customSeparator - separator to be used to separate Date and Time parts
        Returns:
        String formatted time stamp separated by provided separator or ""
        See Also:
        DateTimeConstants

      • getDayOfMonth

        public static String getDayOfMonth()
        This method returns the current day in the month.
        eg:- if Current Day = Dec 19th then this returns 19.
        Returns:
        Current Day in the Month

      • getDayOfMonth

        public static String getDayOfMonth(int incOrDecDays)
        This method returns the Day in the month after Incrementing or Decrementing days.
        eg:- if Current Day = Dec 19th and INcremented by 2 days then this returns 21.
        Parameters:
        incOrDecDays - Increment or Decrement days
        Returns:
        Day in the Month

      • getDayOfYear

        public static String getDayOfYear()
        This method returns the current day in the year.
        eg:- if Current Day = April 12th then this returns 102.
        Returns:
        Current Day in the Year

      • getDayOfYear

        public static String getDayOfYear(int incOrDecDays)
        This method returns the Day in the year after Incrementing or Decrementing days.
        eg:- if Current Day =April 12th and Incremented by 2 days then this returns 104.
        Parameters:
        incOrDecDays - Increment or Decrement days
        Returns:
        Day in the Year

      • convertDateFormat

        public static String convertDateFormat(String dateAsString,
                                       String sourceFormat,
                                       String targetFormat)

        static method to convert an existing date/time String to a specified format.

        Parameters:
        dateAsString - String representation of an existing date/time stamp
        sourceFormat - String representation of the provided format of the time/date stamp
        targetFormat - String representation of the desired format of the time/date stamp
        Returns:
        String representation of the converted date/time stamp

      • getRandomDateForGivenDate

        public static String getRandomDateForGivenDate(String startDate,
                                               int numOfDays)

        Generates random date for given date with Increment or Decrement or number of days.

        Parameters:
        startDate - date to start Random date (MM/dd/yyyy).
        numOfDays - number of days before (-ve) or After (+ve) startDate
        Returns:
        formattedDate Generated Random date (MM/dd/yyyy)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        formattedDate Generated Random date (MM/dd/yyyy)

      • compareDates

        public static String compareDates(String firstDate,
                                  String secondDate)
        This method compares two given dates and return the symbol ( >, < or == ).
        Parameters:
        firstDate - Enter first date in 'MM/dd/yyyy' format
        secondDate - Enter Second date in 'MM/dd/yyyy' format
        Returns:
        It return's status of date, whether it is Greater/ Less/ Equal

      • compareDates

        public static String compareDates(String firstDate,
                                  String secondDate,
                                  String dateFormat)
        This method compares two given dates and return the symbol ( >, < or == ). Both dates should be in same format being passed. Date Format supported are listed with only Dates and not Time stamps. Please refer to DateTimeConstants for Date Formats.
        Parameters:
        firstDate - Enter first date in date Format being passed
        secondDate - Enter Second date in date Format being passed
        dateFormat - only date format supported
        Returns:
        It return's status of date, whether it is Greater/ Less/ Equal

      • compareDates

        public static String compareDates(Date firstDate,
                                  Date secondDate)
        This method compares two given dates and return the symbol ( >, < or == ).
        Parameters:
        firstDate - Enter first date in 'MM/dd/yyyy' format (DATE_FORMAT_DEFAULT)
        secondDate - Enter Second date in 'MM/dd/yyyy' format (DATE_FORMAT_DEFAULT)
        Returns:
        It return's status of date, whether it is Greater/ Less/ Equal

      • getDifference

        public static String getDifference(String firstDateOrTime,
                                   String secondDateOrTime,
                                   int typeOfUnit)
        This method returns the difference between of days/months/years of two given dates.
        Parameters:
        firstDateOrTime - Enter first date in 'MM/dd/yyyy' format
        Enter first time in 'hh:mm:ss' format.
        secondDateOrTime - Enter second date in 'MM/dd/yyyy' format
        Enter second time in 'hh:mm:ss' format.
        typeOfUnit - (use DateTimeConstants....) DAYS/MONTH/YEAR or HOURS/MINUTES/SECONDS
        Returns:
        difference between two dates.
        See Also:
        DateTimeConstants
